summary: This bill, the Integrated Ocean Observation System Reauthorization Act of 2025, reauthorizes and amends the Integrated Coastal and Ocean Observation System Act of 2009. It updates definitions, modifies aspects of the observation system related to data, weather, and coastal information, and changes the role of the 'Council' to the 'Committee'. The bill also includes provisions for funding allocations to regional coastal observing systems and mandates evaluation reports on the impact of the system, particularly during storm events. It authorizes $56 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2030, with a minimum allocation to regional systems.
